data.title: Victor Spinetti, star of The Beatles films, dies after cancer fight aged 82
data.meta_description: Welsh actor Victor Spinetti, who starred in three of The Beatles films, has died at the age of 82 after a battle with pancreatic cancer.
data.text:
Welsh actor Victor Spinetti, who starred in three of The Beatles films, has died at the age of 82 after a battle with pancreatic cancer.

The star died in a hospice in Monmouth this morning, his agent Barry Burnett confirmed.

Burnett, said: ‘He had cancer for a year, but he was very cheerful to the end. I spoke to him on Friday and he was talking about his plans and everything.’

Spinetti was best-known for starring in The Beatles’ three live action films – A Hard Day’s Night, Help! and Magical Mystery Tour.

The band asked him to appear in their first film after watching him in Joan Littlewood’s Theatre Workshop Oh, What a Lovely War!

He later won a Tony Award for his performance.

Spinetti appeared in a number of films, including Under Milk Wood, alongside Richard Burton , Elizabeth Taylor and Peter O’Toole , as well as The Krays.

He also provided the voice of villainous Texas Pete in childen’s cartoon series SuperTed and starred in a Jaffa Cake ad campaign.

Tributes flooded in on Twitter with SteveHay saying: ‘Sad to hear of the death of Victor Spinetti. A great star, fantastic storyteller and a lovely, generous, charming man. Thanks for the advice.’

VIDEO: Check out Victor Spinetti in Magical Mystery Tour

itsKevinJames wrote: ‘Very sad to hear about the passing of Victor Spinetti. A great actor, a lovely, generous man, and wonderful raconteur. RIP dear sir.’

DrNostromo posted: ‘Oh dear Victor Spinetti has died now, sad couple of days for Wales.’

ortidog added: ‘Just heard about Victor Spinetti. He was brilliant in ‘Help!’ with The Beatles.’

While NickyAACampbell tweeted: ‘RIP Victor Spinetti. Was lucky enough to know him. His was an amazing talent.’

View the story “Twitter reacts to Victor Spinetti’s death” on Storify
